From what I understand they Do Not offer a shuttle to Disneyland but there is a car rental company on site and of course Uber/Lyft (or a cab) is always an option.   There was a refrigerator and a microwave in our kind size room, As well as a pull out loveseat. Staff personnel need to be trained on how to greet customers, how to accept complaints with a good attitude. My 6 am wake up call never came in, perhaps the personnel did not know how to set up the phone system.  Need improvements ......!

This place was a 3 star and it costs the same as a 2 star in Long Beach. It has a great location, close to various shopping centers, and the restaurant downstairs was great!

Could be a great place to stay for families  due to its location close to main attractions. Clean rooms and bathrooms, ample parking and high end finishes in the lobby make this place appealing. It lacks english written menus, no american breakfast options for  the kids and ajudgemental front desk agent that treated me like I was a second class guest  when my card declined the first time it was ran. A call to chase bank cleared it up instantly, but I felt  like he had prejudged me the moment  he  saw declined his entire demeanor changed and it showed. All other staff were friendly and accommodating. The rate is high  and  doesn't  align with the options of this hotel. This hotel is an average. The weekend party was very noisy therefore I can't sleep very well due to the noise.The smoking odor come into my room therefore make my asthma worst.  The room is clean daily that what i like.  The location is closed to the Vietnamese community. Also it is close to Disney land.

The cleanliness of the room and the comfort of the bed was what I liked best. We stayed on the 4th floor as the clerk suggested.. He said it was very quiet and it was... What we liked least was the website says "breakfast" and there was not any breakfast.

I think cleanliness is a big reason why customers return and give referrals. I don't recommend this place if you are a clean freak.

This was an average place pictures look nice. Sometime soon at night they have no parking for there guests cuz they have events going on. Which meant we had to wait for one to open up.

Nice and clean and comfortable.

You need to improve before I would recommend more of my friends to stay here.

The oddities were (1) the telephone did not work properly ... Difficulties with messages; could not dial long distance even after asking staff if the long distance service could be activated (2) unless we were out of the room by 10am, our room would not be cleaned even if we requested it (sometimes multiple times) at the front desk (3) breakfast was just carbs, no protein.

Clean bed and room, nothing special. Horrible coffee. And make sure you don't park next to the trees or landscaping we had a ant infestation for our whole trip. Also if your with your kids like I was try to get on too floors they have a night club and can get very loud. Lots of people walking around late at night. Only one elevator works so you will wait a bit for that seems like it's been out for a long time because that's what the attendant said. But at least had a clean bed to sleep in right.

I can't even surf the web or check my email even though I stay at the mid section of the first floor.  The wireless internet speed here is terrible.  Along with me for this stay were two kids and they complain throughout the stay.  I am not recommend this 2-stars hotel because the price I paid for ~$150/night is not worth it. Smell bleach, no track bag, look like BLOOD on my comforter, old man so mean and afraid elevator.

2nd time staying at this place.  First time was okay this time was great as the room was just remodeled with new carpet furniture. ... one issue that the karaoke bar in the lounge was too loud.  We can hear in the room on 3rd floor.

I paid more money to have a suite but it was right close to the karaoke room and we couldn't sleep until 2:00 am. I asked the staff to help us find a parking for our coach but he didn't care. I asked if we can have our driver have a late check out at 2:00 instead of 12 since our group have 14 rooms and we all check out at 6:30 am but they kicked out driver off the room at 12:30 pm! They didn't care! I asked if we can have 1 extra shampoo but no!

Summary Heading: If you want a place to get by, it's here
Summary: The staff is boring... Ehh.. I can hear people talking so loud in the hallway. Moreover, I can even hear the people who were above me walking, thumping...it was just loud and noisy. Overall, it's close to Target store, and lots of restaurants, about 15' of driving to Disneyland Park.
Staying for 5 nights, comfortable bed and friendly front desk. Will stay again if we're going Garden Grove/Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Hope not all Ramadas are like this
Summary: The property was nice and clean. The staff were very unhelpful. We stayed two nights and the maids did not replenish the room supplies at all. The rooms had sensors to turn on the lights. They were set so sensitively that people walking in the hall outside the room set it off.   Both nights there were parties in the room next to ours. When I called the second night to complain, I continued to hear them for another hour.  I am not sure staff called or they just gave out at 3:45 AM.  Staff never had an answer to my questions and always had to go get help. These where simple standard questions like checking out.  I do not recommend this property!

Wonderful Staff and the rooms are clean. The neighborhood is very ruff and you can not tell from the pictures of the property. Wifi is not up to par and cuts out or freezes on a regular basis. The night I was checking in they had bouncers in the lobby for the onsite bar. It looked like a war zone.
Poor service no Cofee cups no glas water The rooms dirty  small beds  No return do not recommend

Summary Heading: Walking distance to Vietnamese and Korean food
Summary: Nice and large lobby and can get quite noisy near the lobby area from the loud hotel lounge and parties at the hotel. Up the floors and in the room, no noise was heard. The rooms were quite clean and carpet fairly new and plush. Minor renovations to sink and other areas. The TV worked, but was a really cheap TV and screen was slightly distorted. Very few channels. Overall, the rooms were clean and hotel has been kept well. It feels like a Vietnamese hotel, but it is walking distance to great Vietnamese food and some Korean options as well. The Vietnamese security guard is bit rude at first, but once he knows you are hotel guest, he will put on a smile and will be much nicer. I guess they have problems with non-hotel guests trying to park cars on the property.

Stayed there for 3 nights. The hotel itself is fine for what it is. Clean, comfortable beds, free parking, decent pillows, decent shower & bathroom. The problem - and it was a big problem - is the extremely bright motion-sensor light in the room just inside the door from the hallway and also one in the bathroom. It was so sensitive that it came on when either of us rolled over in bed at night. Night #1 I was woken at 2am by this and couldn't get back to sleep until 4am, during which time the light came on several more times. I complained in the morning and asked to switch rooms but they said that wasn't possible since we were going to be gone until 9pm that night. They did give me instructions on how to turn it off completely. Unfortunately, those instructions didn't work for

we stayed here last 4year for Vietnamese new year   This year we love more  the room all upgrade it all remodel and also have microwave in the room  very plus    Services  never disappointed I like the services here maintenance Man is Mr Hung is super nice.  over all is happy
Bad customer service bedding not very clean bathroom had multiple malfunctions wifi didn't work

Summary Heading: Would not honor the friends and family voucher due to they wnated the higher rate!
Summary: I called to see why the voucher was not honored. The female I spoke with stated she was the GM but my niece said the GM's name was Tram Nguyen. She stated the voucher was for family only and kept taking over me. The only reason she would not honor the voucher was sue to being sold out and she wanted the higher rate.  She was very rude and unprofessional. I will be calling the GM on Monday and hopefully will get resolution but I doubt it due to  greed!!!
Manager Response: Only Employees and immediate family members are qualified for Employee Discounted Rate, and a complete voucher must be presented upon check in. In this case, we did not have the voucher faxed to the hotel until the next day, and relationship with the Employee was niece and nephew. Per policy, we could not honor Employee Discounted Rate in this case, but we did honor the original price at the time they made reservation. Also, employees are expected to conduct themselves in a courteous, respectful and professinal manner. In this case,  we reveiced a phone call from customers' aunt, clamied to be Wyndham employee, but used a lots of bad words like f.., on the phone, blaming us for not accepting the discount, even though we tried to explain the policy in a professinal manner. She also stated that she would go on Trip Adviser and write a bad review about us. And here it is !

Summary: The shuttle to Disneyland was not available from this hotel any longer as that was one of the reasons I booked there was absolutely no hot water the service was terrible and rude I do not recommend this hotel to anyone I am so disappointed to have spent my New Years at this place
Found this hotel online for a Disney trip.  It was not clean, staff seemed annoyed, and it was loud with thin walls.
Internet is extremely slow Front desk is very unprofessional - not willing to help any with Wyndham reservation
Nice hotel, clean and comfortable. I have suggestion to add continental breakfast and keep trash bags in trash cans in room.

Summary Heading: the rooms are old and not clean
Summary: the front desk people its no polite and have a Korean Bar in the weekend its no parking for guest of the hotel only for the bar
The room was decent,  carpet needs cleaning and the remote control for the TV didn't have batteries  😒

We've stayed at other Ramada's and been happy. This one looked great in the lobby. The rooms were dirty. The balcony had toothpicks, cigarette butts, and trash on it, the bathroom sink had toothpaste residue, and the bed had stains I don't want to know about. He hotel has a bar that was hopping until 2am and ended with drunk people in the parking lot. Not good for families. We were also told we couldn't park on property because the lot was full due to the bar patrons. The Internet also did not work and the food in the vending machine was expired. We will not stay at this location again.

Summary Heading: clean but needs to wash carpets
Summary: In overall the rooms are descent the  beds sheets  are clean and sinks are clean they just need to wash the bathroom curtain, it had some stains the room has a damp odor to it I think its because of the carpet they are dirty we just stayed a night so it was ok not bad but I think not worth the price it also only had 3 channels on tv I think they still use an antenna for the tvs and we had to get up to change it control did not work. I think I expected more for a Ramada just my opinion
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback which will certainly helps us in improving our quality service. Regarding the TV channels, we have been using Direct TV for years. If for some reasons your TV was reset to Antenna, you always had the option to call our 24 hours front desk so they can send our maintenance to fix that problem for you. Thank you again for staying with us.

Summary Heading: Hotel looks OK from outside. Got there at 2PM to check in...
Summary: Hotel looks OK from outside. Got there at 2PM to check in. Told check in is at 3, but web site says 2. Had asked for room on 1st floor but none were cleaned. Room was ok, but dated. Did have a balcony, looking at a abaonded building 15 feet away. Balcony was about 2 feet by 3 feet now cleaned and screens fallen of window. The a/c unit was like a window unit built into the wall on the floor. Had to move a desk and chair to turn it on and then lay on the floor every time to ajust the temp.   Paid $80a night for 2 nights , AAA rate. No breakfast of any kind. WILL not stay there again.

The hotel was fine, clean and organized. It's fine to stay for one or two days at max. My experience of checking in was bad with the weird attitude of the receptionist. He sounded like giving the customer a free stay.

The room size was good however the setup wasn't laid out well. We had an alarm clock but it wasn't plugged in because the cord wasn't long enough.  The microwave was the same, had to pick it up put it on the floor and plug it in for it to work.  The toilet you had to flush 5x for it to finally work and when I called to have them fix it, they couldn't.  The hotel smelled super musty...barf! And the wifi is non existent...was there for 4 nights and it never worked.  Don't think it's worth it for the money!  Stay elsewhere.

Good location for me, and not expensive. The only serious problem was not too serious. The window in my room had no lock on it, but I was on the second floor and it seemed fairly unlikely that anyone would climb up there to break in. OTOH, if you had little kids in your room, you might worry about them getting out the window and onto the balcony while unsupervised.

Summary Heading: Best deal in Garden Grove CA
Summary: We were there for a class reunion, just an overnight stay.  The sink drain plug did not work.  The wi-fi did not connect.  The closed captioning on the tv didn't work.  However, other motels cost significantly more.  It was just what we needed at an affordable price for an overnight stay.
1 night stop. Hotel rooms are being updated with all new furniture, paint and carpet. Very nice. Clean comfortable beds. Would stay here again next time in town.

Summary Heading: Hotel is cleaned but wifi service require upgrade, and very...
Summary: Hotel is cleaned but wifi service require upgrade, and very poor reception.  Hotel need to be flexible in early check in if room become available.
Manager Response: Thank you for feedback. We are in the process of upgrading our internet service. Currently there are not many companies that can bring the good signal to our area. But we will find one for sure. We always honor an early check in for customers during low seasons when there are plenty of rooms available. However, it's almost impossible for us to do so during summer season because we are sold out everyday. Hop you understand. Thank you again for staying with us.

Summary: It was NOT worth for what I had paid. Upon checking in, I was given room that was smelly and dirty. The receptionists were not very welcoming. They look like they did't want to be disturbed.

Was in Garden Grove on business and this was close and reasonably priced.  Very nice room and surprised to find such a nice hotel in this neighborhood.  Would have been nice to have had a complimentary breakfast included.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us. We have a restaurant on site that serves breakfast. . Customers have the option to order breakfast from the menu with mmanyselections. Hope to have another chance to welcome you back here.

Summary Heading: Rooms are run down and old. We keep finding random stuff on...
Summary: Rooms are run down and old. We keep finding random stuff on the floor. Great location if you're trying to stay close to the Little Saigon/Westminster area. There's free internet but don't even bother!! Crappiest Internet of all time!!!

Summary Heading: We all have good time stay with them, everything was nice...
Summary: We all have good time stay with them, everything was nice and clean look, we will come back for our next vacation time.

We booked 2 rooms at this hotel for a stay between 7/26-7/29.  And, it was a terrible mistake.  We stayed in rooms 120 and 122.  After having waited over 45min for the rooms to be "cleaned", we were giving keys to the rooms only to find the cleaning staff still cleaning one of the rooms (room 122).  When we informed the front desk, he was visibly upset (not sure at us or at the cleaning staff since he was short with us when we couldn't get the door to room 120 to open).  Once inside the rooms, we found room 122 to be decently cleaned.  Room 120, however, looked as if someone only straightened up the bedding / towels, and emptied the garbage cans.  The carpet was dirty (like it had not been vacuumed in awhile), the AC unit was covered with dust, there was hair and gunk in the

Room is not clean and the staff manager is not friendly and kind of careless due to so many people there whose need the room, I guess.  This is the 2nd times we stayed at Ramada, but not for next time.  The room is very old and smell.

I really don't want to write a bad review. The hotel has very pleasant staff. We had an issue we our TV and someone came to the door in lest than 5 minutes. I think the hotel may have been beautiful once. There was a granite countertop in the bathroom. The lobby is wide open with high ceilings. But the carpet and furniture in our room were just old. Carpet was stained. The bathroom and the bed linens were very clean. No issues there. Location was easy to find on a main street, south of Disneyland in a quiet Asian neighborhood.

Summary Heading: No one cleaned our room. A room cleaning lady knocked our...
Summary: No one cleaned our room. A room cleaning lady knocked our door at 4:30 and using body language, pointed at her watch, when I asked her why our room was not cleaned. I was guessing she said it's late. So she said "tomorrow ok?". I asked her if she could take all the dirty towels and dumped all the trash at least? She did but did not clean our room on that day :(
This hotel has been improved a bit since I last stayed here about a year ago. It's good, clean. Hotel staff is cordial and helpful. Nice stay!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the nice  feedback that will certainly help us to improve more ad more.

Summary Heading: Room is so dirty. Carpet, and furniture are too old and...
Summary: Room is so dirty. Carpet, and furniture are too old and dirty, too. Cleaning crew was not friendly.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We are in the process of completely remodeling the rooms. 1/4 of the hotel has been done. Please be patient wih us. Thank you.

Summary: The desk clerk was very nice. The room was recently updated you could still smell the new furniture smell. The beddings and towels were so soft and fragrant. Best of all, there were no noises to disturb our rest.

The hotel accommodations very nice for the price. My fiance and I stayed for three nights and the bed was a king size. We had everything we needed in the room. Nice, big bathroom. Good shower. Noise level from other rooms was slightly audible late at night, but nothing to complain about. The hotel wifi was lackluster, however. It hardly ever worked.  I would recommend this hotel to family and friends if they were visiting the area.

The room was clean, customer service was lacking.  The television did not work and the Jacuzzi had no hot water.  We called the front desk seven times in a thirty minute period and the phone was never answered.  We then went to the front desk to let the staff know (only one man was working at the desk that evening) and he informed us to just call back and he would send up a technician for the television.  Well, we could never get the phone answered so we gave up.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for giving us your positive feedback. Apologize for the inconvenience. Normally, customers just let us know 30 minutes before they want to use the Jacuzzi so we can turn on the heatert. We know it's too late now. But anyway, thank you for your feedback. Hope to have another chance to serve you again.

Summary: The rooms were clean, we were able to check in at 2pm, did not need to check out til 12, got things as requested....  Great customer service.   It was funny how most of the guests were Vietnamese.   The jacuzzi was warm but the jets weren't working. Vietnamese bar downstairs so kind of loud on weekends.  If you leave at night, you might lose your parking spot because of the party goers. Wifi didn't really work either. Nice place overall.

Summary Heading: Convenient, clean place to stay. Friendly staff!
Summary: This hotel was conveniently located near Little Saigon area and also provides onsite rental car service if you need to get around town. The staff is friendly and courteous.

Summary Heading: The room was clean. The price was economical. Minor issue...
Summary: The room was clean. The price was economical. Minor issue was the was equipped with a standalone AC. Thus, it is noisy when AC is running.

Summary Heading: It was ok for the short mini vaca we needed it for. The...
Summary: It was ok for the short mini vaca we needed it for. The room was clean. Although I was kind of disappointed that the room didn't have a microwave as stated. We had to use the one in the lobby. The elevator made a scary sound when it stopped too. We thought we were going to get stuck.
Manager Response: Thank you for feedback. We already contacted our elevator contractor, Schindler, regarding your concern. Thank you again for staying with us.

Summary: I had called previously for directions and the person was very friendly and gave me a landmark to look for which would help me find it. It was Easter weekend and hard put to find a reasonably priced hotel. This one saved the day. It also happened to be close to where my daughter lived. The lobby was clean and the desk person was a very friendly, young lady. I and my wife got there late in the afternoon and the cool, clean room was so welcomed. My wife is Asian so it was conveniently close to restaurants and stores. A target was not far. We stayed there two nights and a day. It was quiet at night. I had gotten a 4 person room. The service was good, no complaints. When checking out, the desk person happened to be the one I had talked to before I had gone down there. He was very
Manager Response: Thank you so much for giving us 5 stars. That's our goal, as always !. Hope to have another chance to serve you and your family as our guests. Thanks again.

Summary: Let's just say that the area is less than desirable! Walked in to hotel at late on Friday evning and right in the lobby is 2 nightclubs (Vietnamese nightclub and a Korean Karaoke). Not exactly the type of environment that I want my children around. Had booked for 5 nights and ended up only staying the one, only because it was so late.  Rooms were less than desirable. Very dated furniture, bed uncomfortable.  Staff was understanding and was okay with the cancellation of the additional nights.
Manager Response: Sorry your experience with us was not as pleasant as we wished. Thank you for your feebback anyway.

Summary: The room was spacious but dirty.  The curtains were stained.  Could not open the windows because the screens were not intact.  Great location.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feebback which will certainly help us to improve.

Summary: I booked my stay before reading reviews and once I saw the reviews I was a bit nervous.  My experience was not the horror stories some people seem to write about. The staff was friendly and the room was clean. It's not a fancy hotel as should be known for the price. We stayed while visiting disneyland,  unfortunately they do not have a shuttle that takes you there so we rented a car. It's an easy 15-20 min drive to disneyland. We didnt go to the lounge as it was a family trip but it was busy everynight and quite loud. Since we were on the forth floor we couldnt hear the noise but it may be loud for guests staying in rooms closer to the lounge. They could use some new pillows as they aren't the most comfortable but all in all it was a pleasant stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for your time and your valuable feedback. We will certainly improve.

Summary: Staffs are helpful answerings your concerns but too noisy at night times due to the bar playing music too loud, plus bathroom door cant be locked
Manager Response: Thank you for a very constructive feedback. Really appreciate!

Summary: The Ramada Plaza Hotel(Garden Grove) was a pleasant vacation stay.Room was clean,quiet,and comfortable. Would stay again.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for giving us 5 stars. It really encourages us to keep improving our standards ans services.  Wish to have another chance to serve you as our guests in the near furure.

Summary Heading: The hotel was ok, but the service is not so good. They said...
Summary: The hotel was ok, but the service is not so good. They said the room is ready but its not, i have to tell the service lady to clean so i can move in. The staff on checkin front dest is very mean, no helpful at all. I never have this problem before.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you or your feedback. It will certainly help us to improve our service. Apology for the inconvenience during your last stay with us. You mentioned it never happened before, so we guarantee it won't happen again!  Give us another chance to serve you as our guests and you will see your feeback has been addressed. Thank you again.

Summary Heading: I dont like to stay this hotel anymore .. I called customer...
Summary: I dont like to stay this hotel anymore .. I called customer service ask for 2 more blanket for my kids ( it was too cold in the room ) ... they said cant give more any blanket .. they service really bad for kid
Manager Response: Apology for the inconvenience. We provide a thick comforter for each bed. Also, our rooms do come with the AC/Heaters to make sure you enjoy the right temperature you want. If for some reasos you feel cold, just give us a call, we will adjust the heater to the right temperature to make sure you are warm. Thank you.

Summary Heading: Clean, Good Value and Great Location
Summary: Needed an overnight stay, and picked this property from the Wyndham site. The rate was exceptional and it's location off of CA-22 (and near the I-5) won me over. The neighborhood is heavy in Asian culture, which I found rather enjoyable on my drive through. Free parking and the staff's friendliness was a great welcome. The lobby was expansive, with a night club entrance past the coffee bar. The clerk was a former Army veteran and we shared stories of our service after check in. He even made fresh coffee after my check-in was completed. My room was spacious, clean and in good working order. Even had a microwave oven and refrigerator. Room service was provided by an offsite restaurant, cash only/no room charge. The Shrimp fried rice I had was delicious. And the TV had satellite
Manager Response: Glad to know that you had a pleasant stay with us. Thank you so much for your nice comment. Hope to see you again!!!

Summary Heading: I prefer clean sheets...and somewhat decent treatment!
Summary: When I arrived to check in, I was asked to sit down & the girl would let me know when I could come check in because she was busy talking to another woman who worked there, really? After finally being allowed to check in, I was questioned about the rate that I had been given with my company discount and did I have proof, OTHER THAN the confirmation sheet I had printed, that it was valid to get this discount. She finally settled for the sheet because I was "taking too long" to look up my proof of employment on the computer; there was no one waiting behind me. Since when is a confirmation printout with your name & the rate you were given & agreed to not sufficient??  The first night I was there, someone started hammering (who did NOT know how to wield a hammer, mind you) at 8pm &

Summary Heading: I stayed at this hotel before and even though the room was...
Summary: I stayed at this hotel before and even though the room was not as clean as I would like, I liked to stay here because of the location. This time, I reserved the room for some relatives to go to Disneyland. They did not have a car and the hotel advertised that they had free shuttle to Disneyland. The staff actually did not mention the free shuttle, they gave a number to call for transportation instead. My relatives decided to take the city bus to Disneyland which took them longer to get there. I also saw a cockroach climbing on the bed... I think cockroaches are bad but I was more disappointed about the staff not telling/providing people with whatever they advertised on the web site. I felt like being lied to. I will never stay at this hotel again.

Summary Heading: Good place to stay in Santa Ana
Summary: The staff are friendly, the location is convenient to Vietnamese shops and the hotel is clean.  Would be nice if breakfast is included but unfortunately it is not.
Manager Response: Thank you for a nice and true review !!!

Summary Heading: I was not delight with my experience.  Every thing is just...
Summary: I was not delight with my experience.  Every thing is just average and it could be improve in a lot of areas such as the couch (too old) that makes us not want to seat on, the bathroom wasn't that clean...
I have used the hotel a few times before. Room and the staff generally in good standing. But this time I saw a cockroach on the bed. Omg!!!!  I would never return to that hotel.

I encourage all visitors who visit the area to feel free to stay at the Garden Grove Ramada with confidence that you will have a pleasant stay in any of their comfortable clean rooms with basic amenities and wi-fi in them. A restaurant with good food is conveniently located in the lobby area. There are beverage and ice machines on each floor not far from the elevator. Coin operated washer and dryer available and a pool outside to take a dunk in on those oh so hot days. Convenient parking too! The three day stay was a very affordable one and the staff were friendly. Coffee is ready for all in the morning to get your day started. I keep staying here, you will as well once you arrange your hotel stay at Ramada Garden Grove.
Manager Response: Thank you for such a nice and constructive review!

Summary: Room was not the greatest but was comfortable. Price was good compare to other hotels in the area. Nice lounge on site.
Manager Response: Thank you and hope to see you again !

Summary: It was good to stay in this hotel.  If I will come back to this area, I will book for this.
Manager Response: A few nice words that really help us to improve our services. Thank you.

Summary: furniture is worse than yard sale furniture; pillows are lumpy and hurt your head after the night; no face cloth; all lights were all unplugged when I checked in; some lights are unswitchable because the buttons are missing; asking for hangers is responded with cold shoulders; asking for why the internet is slow faces the same fate; asking for anything is like begging and if staff responded, I was made to feel they bestowed me some favor and I was a beggar; drunk guys from the bar with vulgar language are hanging around in the lobby or rush to the lobby toilet to vomit; you cannot make any phone calls to anywhere from the room unless you pay an exorbitant price per minute, including local calls; a big lie is the fridge and microwave. The web says the room has a fridge and a
Manager Response: Apology  that your stay with us was nothing but unsatisfaction. All of our rooms are provided with  free mini refrigerators.  Microwaves are also free of charge on a first come first serve basic. We always have a microwave in the lobby for public use. Sorry that you had to "beg" for everything. That was absolutely not our type of service here.

Summary: I stayed in the Ramada @ I5, near the summit of the Grapevine in December. Comparatively, that was nicer accommodations, even though I arrived much later in the evening. I had to be asked to move rooms in this place as the first room given to me was musty smelling and the area on the carpet near the sink soaking wet. The desk clerk moved me but didn't seem at all happy about it. The room I ended up in was in much better condition and I enjoyed my stay. Additionally, this particular Ramada has no continental breakfast in the morning. I would not recommend it and I don't think I would stay there again unless I absolutely had to. It was very conveniently located to the place I did business at, so that part was very good. I also thought the room was way overpriced, considering
Manager Response: We are one of the 3 stars hotels that always provide lowest price in the area. Summer is our peak season, so the price may be higher than the other seasons. If you visit us during slow seasons, you will be surprised at our low prices. Thank you for the comment.

Summary: The outside looked really shabby and rundown on the outside. It didn't look any better on the inside. The rooms are small and smell. There were countless stains EVERYWHERE. The furniture desperately needs to be upgraded. The AC smells so bad. The rooms are stuffy. Carpet smells. Lights flicker. The blankets looked like they have been used. Toilet and bathtub is worn out, needs to be replaced. They're cracked and yellowed. Hallways are damp and dim. No lights in the room: just a lamp. Keep in mind that if you don't speak Vietnamese you will not be able to easily communicate with anyone (staff) here. I'm not a picky or high maintenance person, but because of my experience here I am now. Definitely not worth the money, spend it somewhere nicer.
Manager Response: We have so many returned customers for years... Apology for your unsatisfaction with us and thank you again for spending your valuable time to give us your feedbacks.

Summary Heading: Extremely slow and unstable wifi - rooms just ok. Where is the smile?
Summary: Hotel and rooms are a bit outdated. Old furniture and interior. Old and noisy a/c. Rooms are ok size with twin small beds, refrigerator and microwave. We missed inroom-safe.  The wifi is extremely slow and most of the time not working at all. Actually I had to work, but was forced not to. I was not able to send mails, read news, and internet explorer stopped working because the net was so slow. I tried to log on my PC in the morning, mid-day, night... Same wifi problem all the time. Extremely irritating.  This is a 2-3* hotel. No porters helping you with luggage. No breakfast service. Pool area is small, and pool is not heated. Besides of that, staff is friendly but we missed the Vietnamese hospitality and smile. We stayed here for 5 nights and I didn't see one smile. Hotel is

I am a local resident, just happened that our family needs to move out for a couple days while the house can be fumigated. I booked this hotel through Travelocity, and for a couple of reasons; close to home and good price.  Location, for you travellers not from this area, the hotel is about 5.8 miles (18 minutes) from Disneyland, Anaheim and about 1.5  or 2 miles from Little Saigon and right in heart of small Korean community (A section of Garden Grove Boulevard is concentrates of Korean businesses and restaurants).  The room I booked was with 2 double beds and non-smoking, thou they do have smoking rooms offered for those who smoke, I am kinda suprised. The room really clean and air conditionind/heater works good. Also it has balcony.  Within the premises, the hotel has a pool,
Manager Response: Thank you so much for such a detailed and nice review. Glad that we had a chance to serve you as our guests. Wish you all the best.

Summary: Very hard to find with the instructions given. Nice clean hotel with a nice pool and good entertainment at night, we stayed Friday and Saturday. Great location for Disney.We had a south facing room with a small balcony overlooking the pool.

This hotel caters to Asians and has a Vietnamese restaurant on site.  The noodle bowels were great and room service was fast.  Good size comfortable rooms.  I had no problems and the place was clean.  I would stay there again.
Manager Response: So glad they we had a chance to  serve and make your stay enjoyable.Thank you for a nice feedback !

Summary: I guess this Hotel did not care about the smell in the hotel and did not care about the smoking or none smoking room

This seems to be a family owned place. The staff was warm and the rooms large. I especially loved the door and window that opened out on to the balcony so we could turn off the air conditioning. Even the maids were very kind.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for giving us 5 stars. We are not a family owned hotel, however, we are so glad that at least we made you feel at home ! Thank you again and hope to see you back in the future.

Summary: it wasn't the worst place I have stayed it was average, very clean, people operating the hotel were very nice. It reminded me of a upper class Mexico hotel the way it was built and the location. The view I had was of a building under construction that seems to have been abandoned. Beds were very comfortable along with the pillows. The parking was not the best very tight space with few spots. It seemed like it was a hotel people took up full time residence in.
Manager Response: We are glad that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for the nice comments and hope to see you back in the future.

Summary: Since this seems to be an older hotel, I let it slide. The beds were comfortable. The shower was very therapeutic.  However, no one expects to pay for a room and see stains on their linen. It makes you think it could be dirty.
Manager Response: Appreciate your feedback. We will certainly improve.

Summary Heading: Very comfort place to stay . Efficient and helpful staff...
Summary: Very comfort place to stay . Efficient and helpful staff. Nice lobby, Comfort bed and clean.  Towel looks old and smelly. Overall, it is good deal compare to quality. Will stay when coming back
Manager Response: Thank you for the nice words... Hope to have another chance to welcome you back here.

Summary: This hotel is OK if your looking for a cheap place to stay in the area. I've stayed there stayed there twice so far so i can vouched it's only good for that. The service is alright. It needs a major reno to the decor for sure. On myasthenia stay I would say I was a little disappointed In my room had a smell coming from from the sink the wasn't pleasant and it they claimed they couldn't smell anything at all.

Summary Heading: BEDBUGS WARNING!!! No management on site at night!
Summary: BEDBUGS!!! ROOM 420 WARNING. No management on site at night. I got bit by bugs all over my body. At first I thought I had hives so I took a shower. Brown bugs crawling on me and falling off with hot water. I packed everything up and calle  the hotel main office they said no manager on dutty call in the morning. I left and called travelocity for.  Refund, they tried to negotiate with th  hotel but TRAM th  manager refused. Manager said I had an early checkout and they persinally inspected the bed. NO REFUNDS so dont take.  Chance. I'm going to my doctor today and sending them the bill
Manager Response: We are 100% bedbugs free as per routine inspections by Heath Department. Regarding this case, customer already used the room for 8 hours ,from 4pm - midnight. When our board of management inspected the room after the customer left, we found many empty bottles of alcohol in the room, plus 6 full bottles in the refrigerator, which we are keeping as lost and found in case customer wants to come back and get them. We understand customer comment is very important, but we felt this case was not qualified for a refund. We are willing to deal with any legal issues should the customer want to go further.

Summary: My daughter and I stayed at the Garden Grove Ramada while on vacation to Disneyland. The hotel seems to be in a safe neighborhood.  It's close to everything-  grocery stores, walmart, costco, and Disneyland!  The staff is friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean. My only complaint is that our microwave was missing the glass plate and there are not many channels available to watch on tv.  I have already suggested this hotel to my friend.
Manager Response: Million thanks for  giving us 5 stars...

Summary: I went to the ReCongress in Anaheim and most of the hotels near the Convention Center were packed, so I looked a little farther, I am glad I did. The hotel is clean, quiet, and comfortable. The staff was very courteous and attentive to our needs. I would go back there for sure.
Manager Response: Thank you so so much for giving us 5 stars. We appreciate and hope to have another chance to welcome you back at our hotel.

Summary: I was put up in this hotel for 9 nights.. It was by far one of the worst business trips I ever had. . The front desk can barely speak English. . Very hard to understand. . The restaurant opens up late in the evening. . It is for only Asian fare. . They have karaoke most nights so it gets very loud. . I understand it is in The Korean district. . But they should let people know before they visit what type of atmosphere they will be in. .
Manager Response: So sorry you felt this way after 9 nights of stay with us. You always have the option to check out earlier than your plan as long as you give us 24 hours notification in advance. Anyway, thank you for choosing to stay with us !

Summary Heading: i was told that i double book at this hotel via expedia and...

Summary Heading: I stayed there two different times in February.  Both rooms...
Summary: I stayed there two different times in February.  Both rooms needed updating and the pillows were very hard.  But employees were very nice and it was a clean hotel.
This hotel is very nice and very clean.  I have traveled all over Asia, and the hotel definitely has an Asian feel to it.  I like it and will continue to stay there.

Overall, my stay was only mediocre. I would have given a greater rating but the service that I was given was extremely poor. The man at the front desk, Tony, was completely rude and would argue with me. He was not helpful whatsoever. There was an error on the bill and when I asked Tony what the extra charge was about, he was not very nice and would not give me a direct answer, merely stating that I had to pay it. His manager, Tram, on the other hand was very helpful and told me in a very nice manner why I was charged. The issue I have was not with the bill but rather with Tony. I most likely be staying at another hotel for my next visit in the area due to the manner in which I was treated.

Summary Heading: The hotel is clean. The price is acceptable. The staffs are...
Summary: The hotel is clean. The price is acceptable. The staffs are very friendly and very professional. The location is convenience to the Little SAIGON.The front desk helper name's Tony was very nice and very helpful info that I need while on our trip ,Thanks Tony, we'll be back.
Good location, will come back , room cleaning. You can watch 2 Vietnamese TV channel free. Not too far from John Wayne airport
The hotel is clean. The price is acceptable. The staffs are friendly and professionally. The location is convenience.

Summary Heading: Makes a copy of your credit card and ID
Summary: I noticed when the person ahead of me was checking in, the clerk walked away with their credit card and ID and went into an office nearby. They did the same with me. Afterwards, I looked into the office and a photocopier was in plain site.  The sound of a copier could be heard when they left with your card and ID. What other business would we accept this from?  That's why I always use a passport, never a drivers license. A passport has no address and the passport number is arbitrary. The address I give the hotel is a meaningless business address with no connection to me.  The room air conditioner was a window unit that was at floor level, so you had to crawl on the floor, under a table, to operate it. That would get old for a longer stay, I was there only one night. The room

Summary Heading: A perfect hotel when visiting Little Saigon
Summary: Hotel was price right. Very clean and comfortable room. Free parking and wifi.   The hotel is located very close to Little Saigon and is located in a Korean area. The area is very quiet and has very good Korean barbecue & Vietnamese restaurants.  Will stay here again when visiting this area of Los Angeles.
Manager Response: Thank you. Hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: It is very comfortable to stay at this hotel. every thing...
Summary: It is very comfortable to stay at this hotel. every thing is nice and clean. Thanks for good service.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us .

Summary: We stayed here for three nights, and I would only recommend this hotel if you're not expecting much.  What really bothered me about this hotel is that the occupants dont really understand that they shouldnt be talking at the top of your lungs at 2am.  People were walking down the halls and talking and laughing loudly, and I found this to be rude.  I even had to call the front desk because a group of men were outside my window at 2am having cigarettes and talking loudlyt. Icoulkd not sleep at this hotel.  Being that it seems like it caters to the vietnamese travelers, people may or may not find this hotel appealing.  I felt like I was in a crappy hotel in vietnam.    Not the most professional staff, and I would only stay here again if I absolutely had to.
Front desk helper was very nice, very helpfull info that I need while on my trip , Thanks I'll be back
Manager Response: Thank you. Looking forward to serving you as our guests again.

Summary: Highly recommented you stay at Ramada plaza. Great service, friendly. 4 start rate. Great location for visit Little Sai Gon and Disneyland. Next to Korea town also.
Manager Response: Thank you. Hope to see you again.

Summary Heading: Too generous giving this hotel 3 stars
Summary: Stayed 3 nights but couldn't sleep at all for the Ac ran too noisy. It woke us  up every time it kicked on/off. Staff were ok accepted Mr. T sounded unfriendly when taking booking. Needed a lot of improvements in order to rate it 3-4 stars.

Hi, I firstly to book the hotel. As this hotel is Vietnamese, so I called them to book the hotel. They said $80/ night after tax. As I booked at January, my stayed at August. Then on August when I came to this hotel, they said $120/ night. I told them, only $80/ night. They said if I did not agree with this price, just went away. I felt terrible, as this time so short time to hard find the hotel and also it was school holiday in USA. So I must agreed this deal.
Dirty sheeting and towel. Stain on sheeting and towel. So hard to find parking on weekend with the bar on the lower level. Microwave so nasty. Hair dryer only work on high not with low.

Summary Heading: I was not satisfy with the service.. The suite was dirty...
Summary: I was not satisfy with the service.. The suite was dirty and small.. It was not what I expected .. They said it was a VIP room but it was worse than a normal standard room at other hotels.. I will not go back there again..

Summary Heading: The sink wasn't cleaned, it was smelly, staff was...
Summary: The sink wasn't cleaned, it was smelly, staff was disrespectful, lobby was too noisy, too many people in front loitering, decorations were terrible, room was not cleaned, we absolutely had to check out early because we did not feel comfortable.

We just returned from Ramada Plaza Garden Grove/Anaheim and really loved this hotel. The rooms are very clean and spacious. Each day the lobby is stocked with free coffee and tea which I thought was great. The swimming pool is very clean. The parking lot is clean.
Like all lodging in Little Saigon, this has a strong Vietnamese flavor. Room was marginally but good value for the price. Had a distinct odor to it as well. Very convenient to Disneyland.
Hotel building is very old. Carpet is terrible and the room smells. Bed very average and the sheets kept coming off. Shower ok, bathroom ok.

I plant to stay 5 days , when I got there I disappointed the hotel was ok but expensive with the price I paid 105/day.the room was old the bath room was too old model just upgrade for painting. So that's why I'm just rated for 2 sorry.

The accommodations were pleasant and the staff were friendly and helpful. The only problem I had was that they weren't able to get any Emails through to my Outlook account. So, I had to do everything over the phone, or in person.

Summary Heading: Overall I like this hotel not only good services but also...
Summary: Overall I like this hotel not only good services but also perfect location....I will introduce for my family, my friends to stay in this hotel if they have vacation or travel in LA.....
close to korea town and Vietnamese town.  lots of business and restaurant around. Hotel is average. Wall a/c.  average beds.  Small refrigerator should be replaced due to bad odors.

We reserved a none smoking room for 4 days in this hotel.  They gave us a room # 213 on second floor and this is a horible room if you are none smoker.  After the first night we start to experience all the smoking smell came through the vent.  We called the front desk twice and they only came and spray the room with the chemical stuff but without letting us exchange different room with an excused that all hotel room was booked. In additional to that the pillows is so high but the bed is too soft so your body feel like shrinking down when you sleep on top of the bed.  When we checked out the elderly gentlement has an unfriendly attitude when we asked him a simple question regarding about the room rate which was different than the amount that we have reserved because we don't
Manager Response: First of all, thank you for taking the time out of your schedule to give us  some feedback regarding your stay at our hotel. We apologize that your experience was anything less than satisfying. You booked for a non-smoking room, so we gave you room #213, which is a non-smoking room and on a non-smoking floor. Normally, we are always willing to switch the room for our guests if there are any available. Unfortunately, we were booked up on that night, that was why we just be able  to try our best to refresh the odor in that room for you.   Secondly, our hotel does not have state tax. The only thing you have to pay is the room charge and the city tax, which currently is 14.5%.  Hope our clarification make you feel better. Again, please accept our apology for the inconveniences during your stay with us.

Summary: The facilities were clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. The only things that really need improvement would be the business kiosk needs to be updated, and the treadmill in the gym needs to be adjusted.

Over all it is very good location. Standing outside you would  like to stay.  However, when you enter to the room, its design looks old and needs fresh air.  The bed is not firm enough for best sleep.   Moreover, they let us stayed in the room that was fixed in the morning. The paint on the cabinet's door in bathroom were still wet.  We smell a paint but just stated that when our pants get wet paint on them.  When we check out and complain about that, the clerk has no words to sorry, They just say that I can request a new room if I did not like something.  If they are good maintenance,They have to check everything before  let their customers walk in in any room. I feel so sorry for their bad services,  I won't refer any friend to Ramada Plaza Hotel.  Peter
Service are fine, Pillows are bad, we need a better firm one.   Great location for the Vietnamese  The best of this hotel that make me keep returning is the home warm welcome management.
The hotel and service was great, although the veiw from the balcony was a steel building it was peaceful and nice.  The pool was smaller than expected but it was refreshing.

Rooms are very old.  A/C in my room looks 20 years old - makes huge noise that we could had hard time falling asleep.  The bathroom was a whole lot worse.  It had sewage-like smell in it.  I kept the fan running but no help.  No free continental breakfast available.  I would not recommend this hotel.  All TV channels were very poor in quality.  They looked analog.  Sorry....

Summary Heading: 14 nigths at Ramada Plaza Garden Grove
Summary: I stayed 14 nights at the Rmada Plaza Garden Grove from March 3 to 14, 2013. This is the 3rd time that I icome back to this hotel for convenience reasons. I must say I'm quite satisfied with the quality of the service, the cleanliness and the niceness of all the staff. I would recommend to anyone who needs to be in that area, and a romm at  the 4th floor is my favorite. I didn't try the VIP Restaurant as the hotel is situated very near from all the Asian restaurants and eateries of the area.

Do not stay here, especially with your family. The hotel is not close to Disneyland (5+ miles). It is in the middle of Korea town and the staff barely speaks English. Bums were outside in the parking lot. The lobby is ok, but the room we checked into was hot and smelt horrible. I would not let my kids touch anything or sit. When i sat on the edge of the bed the mattress lifed off the frame, and im not a big person. We pulled back the sheets and pillow cases, everything was stained. Room was dusty. The "balcony" was full of pigeon poop. we informed the front desk staff we could not stay and she would not issue us a refund until we fought with her and made her go look at the room. Finally she agreed but gave the run around, we had to wait until later that night until the manager
Manager Response: Saying all of these just to get back full refund is very unkind and unfair for us.

Summary Heading: noise level on top of my room.
Summary: We could not have a good rest at night time due to the noise of foot steps on top of my room.it was more severe during the midnight and in early morning.we could hear people talking on the outside of the room and along the hallway.is there way we could eliminate that noise so that privacy is more enhanced to people sleeping inside the room.  Yours sincerely,  Tiep nguyen

Never have we ever stayed somewhere where the staff was so rude! Upon checking in we found out that not only did we not have a wheelchair friendly room but that there was no shuttle service that could transport anyone in a wheelchair. After arguing with the man at the front desk for at least 20 mins he finally got the manager on the phone as I requested at the beginning. The manager then told us that we could rent a wheelchair from Disneyland and basically the problem would be solved. Not so. If you or your family are in a wheelchair then you can see what a big deal this is. Finally was told that they would pay for our cab or they would try to fit us on the hotel van. To save stress we decided to drive and and pay for parking. The hotel did reimburse for parking fees but on the
Manager Response: We are very disappointed to see this. All of our efforts to accomodate you and your family for 4 nights and to make you and your family enjoy Disneyland were not appreciated at all. We offered a 12 seat van out of our schedule just to take your family and the wheelchair to Disneyland, but one person from your family suggested us to let him drive because there were some little kids in the family, they might need to go back and forth. He asked us if we could pay the parking fees for him for 4 days. We were willing to do that just to make you and your and your family happy. After 4 days staying with us, the same man came to do the check- out process. He told us everyone, especially the wheelchair person, did enjoy Disneyland. So just very surprised and disappointed to see this comment.  What other nicer thing could we do???

Summary Heading: Would not honor a reservation price
Summary: A perk of my employer's is membership in Lifecare which gives discounts. I reserved a room here but when I arrived the desk clerk refused the discount price. She said anyone can use a discount number, not just members. She was pleasant while telling me essentially to forget it. Eventually she offered a 10% discount. I left. Found a great room a few miles away at a Super 8 in Westminster.

First, I have stayed in many, many hotels all around the world including some of the very best.  As a result, I am very conservative when awarding stars.  Five stars is truly exceptional in every way.  I chose the Ramada because the hotel I normally stay in was fully booked.  I booked through Orbitz and prepaid the entire amount.  Check in was quite easy and the staff was very accommodating when I requested a quiet room.  I did not mind giving them a credit card for incidentals but did not like it at all when they photocopied a copy of my drivers license.  This, by the way, is against California law.  If I had more time, I would file a complaint.  The issue is identify theft security.  The room was food and furnished adequately.  That being said, it is indicative of the hotel

Summary Heading: I have good deal and the price is affordable. the location...
Summary: I have good deal and the price is affordable. the location is very much close with everything you need

Check in took less than 2 minutes, provided my ID and Credit Card and had my room keys ready. The hotel is dated from the outside , same as the room as you can see in the pictures. Bed was comfortable, big Flat TV and very comfortable bed. Room had a fridge, free toiletries and plenty of towels. Shower head was excellent with lots of water pressure and hot water. Carpet was dirty and had some stains same thing as the decorative pillow. Not bad for 1 night to sleep and rest after working.

Summary Heading: The front desk staff was professional and helpful, a more...
Summary: The front desk staff was professional and helpful, a more cheerful demeanor would've welcomed me more to your hotel but I will return.

The toilet : The water in one flush not many and running very weak. Must to flush 2 or 3 times to keep its bowl clean. Why does it working like that ? TV : It had did not have 2 stations of C6 & C8 as displayed on menu. Why ? The front desk was helpfull. The services was OK.

The check-in process was fast and easy, and every staff member I encountered was helpful and friendly. The room was a nice size and clean, and the bathroom was rather large and very clean.  The floor I stayed on smelled just a little bit "funny" but I didn't notice the smell when I got into my room.   The property was very well kept, and I don't have any complaints.

My 2 sisters & I were glad we selected Ramada Inn for our 6 nights stay in Garden Grove.  The room toiletry was sufficient except for one night and the service personnel friendly. The only thing I did not like was the misleading ad. in the Vietnamese TV which led people to believe there is a shuttle service provided by the Hotel between the J.Wayne Airport and Hotel.  Actually the service was provided by a 3rd party but the desk attendant did not provide its phone number.  The 3rd party driver was polite and very pleasant to work with. recommend you revise the ad and instruc desk attendants to provide the 3rd party phone number.

The beds are horrible!  Called front desk and no one ever picks up?  The area looks alright.  It's close to disney if that's your concern.  The hotel is mainly run by Asians just so you know just in case that's not your cup of tea.

The staff were all very friendly and helpful.  The room was large, clean and the bed was very comfortable.  The location is convenient, the internet was speedy and free.  No problems here for us, would recommend to others.

Summary Heading: Perfect for our first trip to Disneyland!
Summary: We really enjoyed our stay here.  Staff really friendly and accommodating.  Hot breakfast fantastic, very convenient shuttle bus that for $4 will take you to Disneyland - picks you up from front of hotel, shuttle leaves about every 20 min.   Short walk from hotel to Cheesecake Factory!  Beds comfy, rooms clean and great wifi.

Te room was very clean and came with a frige but no microwave. I guess I could have kept my food cold and drinks but not warm up any scrumptious snacks :( Also the jacuzzi jets did work even though it had seemed liked it had not been cleaned in a couple days. It never got hot or even close and I sat in it at least an hour Turing the dial every fifteen minutes that was missing the knob (ouch on the fingers) and failed to ever get warm let alone hot:(((((
The service is very good. The room is clean. Location is very convenient. Staffs are very friendly & helpful. We love our stay.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for a 5-star review. Hope to welcome you back.

Summary: Staff very friendly, decent price for neighborhood and surrounding areas. Appreciated front desk getting back to me immediately for any questions.

Summary Heading: Great value for a Disneyland trip
Summary: Staff was superb and the distance from Disneyland was about a 10 min drive. There is a free shuttle to the park, but we had a car with us and parking was free. Free tea/coffee in the lobby was appreciated by all. Room was nice and clean, wifi fast, and service outstanding.
experience was good the room was clean. like that. also liked that hotel has a shuttle. but would been more convenient if shuttle could pick us up at times later than 10:00 p.m..
Manager Response: Thank you for spending time to give us some nice feedbacks regarding your stay with us. Currently, our free shuttle just runs until 10:30 pm the latest , making sure that our guests can enjoy the firework show at 9:30pm  :-) . Hope to have a chance to welcome you back.

Summary: The Ramada Plaza is an excellent hotel. Very clean, rooms are big and spacious, has windows that you can open to let fresh air in. Offers a free breakfast (tho the toaster was the slowest i have ever used).  Staff were very  helpful except the hotel only accepted cash for the Southern California City Pass, they didnt let you pay on card which was inconvenient.  There are restaurants, cafe's up the street to eat, aswell as Disneyland etc are a 10min walk.  Would definitely stay at this hotel again.
Manager Response: If this nice comment is for our hotel, please accept our sincere appreciation. However, just to clarify that we currently don't offer free breakfast , and our hotel is 4 miles away from Disneyland.

Summary Heading: NOT a Place I Would Stay (Again)
Summary: While I did not experience any smells that other reviews mention, I experienced a room that was not completely cleaned before my arrival.  We were provided with 2 double beds (not queen sized). We are not large people, but could not share one bed.  I asked the front desk if we could be moved to a king bed room.  The person did not even look at any paperwork or computer.  She said, "No." I asked if the hotel was full.  It was not, but they were expecting more check-ins later so I could not be moved.  She made the decision to ignore my concerns for people who hadn't even checked-in yet.  Not my brand of customer service.  It gets worse.  There wasn't extra toilet paper in the room.  I stepped out of the room to speak with a maid in the hall.  She asked me for my room number and

Summary Heading: the location and the staff working at Ramada hotel that we stay
Summary: The location is very good , Room is very clean and very quiet , we like it a lot   The` staff very friendly they help us everything we need .
Manager Response: Thank you for a nice 5-star review. Looking forward to welcoming you back and serving you as our guests.

Summary: I do really like location and very convenience area for all people travel around garden groove. But to stay there is really like terrible like you smell someone throw up on the carpet, the odor smells make you sick and headache. Hope you guys change all the carpet and fix all broken stuff for the next guest, otherwise you guys will loose all the precious customer.

Hotel is very well appointed. Has complementary shuttle service to and from Disneyland that we enjoyed. Staff made us feel welcome. Metro bus service is just outside to all of LA. Get the 1 day Metro pass for $7 and ride anywhere. We went to Huntington beach in 40min. Only problem we had was small ants in the sink when we left soda out. They sprayed area and even offered us a different room .Best seafood place called the Wild Crab is 1 block away. My wife and I ate lobster and King crab legs with drinks for only $40. Where can you go wrong here? We will definitely come back here on our next visit to LA.
Manager Response: Thank you for you constructive feedback of our hotel. Glad that you enjoyed our complimentary shuttle service to and from Disneyland as well as out service staff. We do apology for the ant problem. Besides our routine pet control company, we are hiring Orkin to take care of this problem now . Everything is under control so far. Thank you again for taking your time to review your stay and give us your feeback.

Summary: I did my research & pictures looked perfect.  I was soooooo wrong.  People at the front desk was average but the rooms were HORRIBLE!  Ants crawling everywhere, damp smelly hallways, blanket/ pillows/room smelled of stale stinky cigarettes..never ever will I stay here again!

Summary Heading: It depends on who works at the front desk
Summary: We arrived on Friday, June 29, 2012. A grumpy old Vietnamese man was at the front desk and refused to help us with baggage. "Get a trolley cart" he said with a heavy accent. We told him the cart was nowhere in sight. "Go outside and find" he replied in broken English. In the past I have smacked people with this kind of attitude. But I reluctantly kept my New Year's resolution and didn't that night.  It was very late. We were exhausted as we flew from France. We decided to stay for the night and to leave the very next day. The room was comfortable. We slept soundly.  The next morning, on Saturday, June 30, the old cranky receptionist was replaced with the manager Ms Tram Nguyen and two other men. All three were courteous, professional, and helpful. We decided to stay another

Summary: Last week i stayed at this Hotel everything was okay except The Houskeeping workers cars look like homeless their was trash evwrywhere cans by the clean close and the Ladys dnt look clean or profesional their hair was messy and their uniforms looked dirty as well. I asked one of the housekeepers to bring me shampoo and she had food, sodas, tortillas in her cart wat kind of Hotel is this never again will i go their !!!

I was in the area for business and stayed here.  Upon check-in I found the man at the desk to be gruff and he didn't speak English well.  When I went to my room, housekeeping was in there and they had just started cleaning the room.  I toted all my stuff back down to the desk and told him the room wasn't ready.  He questioned my sanity.  Then he began yelling over the walkie-talkie for the housekeeping person to come to the desk.  Then a nice lady came out from the office and told him to give me another room.  This time it was a first floor room not far from the lobby (which was filled with tourist and children...NOISY!)  As I made my way to my new room I had to walk through the tiled floor where swimmers enter into the building.  The floor was wet and dirty.  The room seemed

Hotel is in the Korean district, nothing around to eat. Awful smell in room. Was not clean. Huge crack in the bathroom floor that over 50 ants came out of and filled the bath tub. They sprayed with raid but some of the ants returned the next day. Huge spider in tub. Boogers were stuck to the bathroom wall with hairs sticking out of them! Stepped on something sharp sticking out of the carpet. Stayed here while we went to Disneyland, I am not picky about hotels since I do not spend much time in them, but I seriously considered paying for a whole new hotel to avoid staying there.

Originally looking to stay in the Little Saigon area, and was referred to this hotel by another hotel (Little Saigon Inn in Garden Grove, CA) that was fully booked. Wasn't sure what to expect but was pleasantly surprised. Parking underground was free, as was internet which was wireless 'N' (another good surprise). Room was clean, double beds were comfy, and mini-bar fridge was very useful. My relatives who stayed at the other hotel were ENVIOUS when compared to their hotel. After we left after a few days to head home, my relatives who stayed back for a few extra days, moved into our suite!  As for location, you're next to Little Korea (next block) and 5 mins from Little Saigon. Plenty of food options and site seeing!

We traveled from Tucson Az this hotel was rated at a 3 star and when we got there it was more like a 0 star.  I am not a high mainteance person just as long the room is clean and the bathroom.  So we get into our room the bed is dirty when I asked housekeeping if they could change the sheets out she gave me towels to clean it myself.  Then there was no airconditioning in the room we also had the TV that only had chinese language. When I went to the front desk to ask them about the air conditioning and the tv they just smiled and had no idea what I was saying I checked out of there within the hour they did not care about there customers and concerns.  IT WAS THE WORST.  I ended up spending more money to book another hotel and at least we stayed in comfort and clean hotel with air

When staying at a holiday location it is more about location.  Travelling from Australia to Vegas then to Anaheim we wanted amenity and comfort.  Ramada Plaza has a free breakfast bistro,  first rate value wise and breakfast is just another meal so cereal and American breakfast did the job.  Staff were very friendly and courteous.  We did the Disneyland thing which was a short walk from the Hotel without hassle of cars and parking.  All the food places including the Garden Grove Mall were close.  We used John's Transportation 7---- to access the factory outlets for a great rate,  he was the recommended transporter of the Hotel and is a great bloke.  Rooms do have thin walls but hey it is not 5 star so who cares.  It was clean and was tidied everyday.  Highly recommend this

Summary Heading: Enjoyable -- and for a good price, too.
Summary: I stayed at the Ramada Plaza Hotel during a trip to visit some friends in the Anaheim area. I really liked the hotel and would definitely recommend it to other travelers looking for a cozy room for a great price. The location is also nice and peaceful -- quite close to Korea Town and Little Saigon, so the food options are plentiful and appetizing. When I return to the Anaheim area, I will definitely stay at this hotel again.

I stay at Ramada Plaza last week to visit my relative and also for a wedding party. I am very happy with the service, room is clean with big screen TV. I recomend this hotel with all my freinds who visit OC.

the room smelled bad... not clean houskeeping came at 6,7,8 am.  someone came into the room and stole a bag.... hmmmm..... you have to wonder who has access to the room keys.... just be careful with all your belongings.... and the management didn't even want to call the police to make a report... i have to wonder how many other times this has happened....

Went there for my husband's school reunion.  The location is not close to anything.  You walk in the lobby and there is a microwave for people to heat up left over food.  The rooms are small, the a/c had an odor, and they barely passed the clean standard.

At short noticed we needed a hotel in Garden Grove, and chose this one. It was ok, but no where near as nice as the Ayres in Anaheim we stayed in a few days later.  This hotel has a lot of smoking rooms on the lower floors so we couldnt use our balcony / windows as the smoke would drift up and into our room. The Karaoke was noisy and the doors were all left open which was annoying, but luckily our room was a long way from that so we could escape.  Washing facility was good and the location for Garden Grove was good, but less so for Disney of course.

Summary Heading: best service ever for 68 year old traveler
Summary: This hotel is a real gift for a traveler and the price of $85 for day one, $75 thereafter, is a bargain that's hard to match anywhere.  My wife and I had stayed here a few years ago and were pleased to find on return that price was the same.  You need to realize that in neighborhood hotels, in neighboring Santa Ana, for example, you can really get unfairly worked over with bad quality hotels.    One specal thing about this hotel is the service--whatever your need is--using the free computers, turning on the outdoor spa, getting a special map about how to get from here to there (better than a GPS), the front desk persons will stay with you until your request for a regular or an extra service is needed. Continental Breakfast - If you are on tight budget, this free breakfast can save you a lot. They serve coffee, bread, apples, bananas, etc.  Cons: Room Key - It does not work during check in. Shuttle - The front desk will tell you that you need to make reservation to be accomodated on the shuttle. However, the drivers schedule of pickup and drop off are unreliable. Summary Heading: Not what I expect of a 3-star
Summary: Husband and I stayed here for one night in July and were very disappointed. This hotel is not at all what I expect from a 3 star. I've stayed in nicer Motel 6's. While the lobby is classy looking the hallways and rooms are very outdated and smelled somewhat. The mattress in our room felt like it was 20 years old. Two nice things I can say - the bathroom was really clean and they had free wireless internet access in the rooms. Still not worth the $69 we paid on Hotwire.

Summary Heading: Decent hotel, but forget about the shuttle
Summary: We stayed at the Ramada Plaza hotel in June 2005.  We chose this hotel because it looked decent and was priced about $30 to $50 less than other Disneyland area hotels.    We are not looking for anything special as far as hotels go, since most of our time is spent at Disneyland.  The hotel is easy to find and is in kind of a run down neighborhood.  There was plenty of parking, including an underground garage which we didn't use.  We were only staying one night (Sunday).  We got there Sunday morning at 8:45 AM to catch the free Disneyland shuttle that runs once per hour.  Bad idea.  First of all, they have one 15 seat shuttle that operates once per hour to serve the entire hotel.   I had called the hotel a week prior to our stay to make sure we would have room on the shuttle. This is a good value for the money.  We stayed a Tuesday, Wednesday in early June and paid $45./night.  I thought it was worth the money and although it wasn't fancy by any stretch, it was clean and reasonably quiet and kept up.  It's an older property, so there is a slight mustiness about it, but once we turned the AC on it blew out the stale air and was just fine.  If you are used to three star or better, you won't like this...but if you're a motel 6 type (like us) this is right up your alley.  It is on the very edge of the Korean district, but that's not a big deal- parking lot and location was very safe and we weren't bothered at all by it.  I would stay here again...
